author: ajsutton
content: Nothing enforces the aggregator to use their own view (except incidentally via the beacon node api design) but its in the aggregators self interest to aggregate their own attestation so I think it makes sense for the spec to acknowledge that and design for it being the honest behaviour.

author: potuz
content: The spec specifically says that the aggregator has to use the same data that the validator would use, so that implies being his same view

author: ajsutton
content: But is there actually any validation of that? Ie is the aggregate rejected if they don’t

author: potuz
content: There are a lot of things that the spec doesn't enforce, but <@1035747431461167125>'s reading about the view is correct though

author: ajsutton
content: Oh yeah, not disagreeing with that. Just pointing out that since it’s in the interest of the aggregator to aggregate their own attenuation it makes sense to define the honest validator behaviour as doing that. We sometimes define honest behaviour as doing something altruistic (or very indirectly incentivised) but generally try to avoid specking honest behaviour that is obviously against self-interest.

author: ajsutton
content: But if you were prepared to self sacrifice for the greater good of the network you could post your best aggregate even if it doesn’t include your attestation.

author: potuz
content: Oh you mean to explicitly specify that the best aggregate should be preferred regardless of the own view? That even may be, but explicitly specifying it's own view is a step up. Not saying anything and allowing the best behavior is strictly better

author: potuz
content: The analog in the proposing side would be like explicitly saying that the proposer should not include attestations from a contending branch that give him zero reward
